header.title: The best Fence installation company in Vallejo
bullets: Helping customers in Vallejo with fence repair and replacement!
We streamline the fence building process to make it convenient for everyone.
Use our 3D modeling tool to build a free custom fence quote online.
We let you transform your property without the hassle that comes with construction companies!

Yelp.description: I had a great experience with Ergeon. The entire team I worked with was helpful and professional. Maria started off by scheduling a virtual walkthrough soon after I reached out to them. I then worked with the project manager Shey who was great at keeping me informed of the process and answered all my questions. I now have a nice section of fence and a new gate that I have needed for a while now. I would definitely recommend giving Ergeon a call if you have need of new fencing.
Yelp.name: Robert P.
Yelp.title: The entire team I worked with was helpful and professional

Google.description: I hired Ergeon for a fairly large project. Overall I'm quite satisfied with their work. My initial phone conversations were informative and helped me to plan properly. I'll definitely hire them again for my future fence work.
Google.name: Rhitwick G.
Google.title: I'll definitely hire them again for my future fence work.

regulations.title: Permits & Regulations
regulations.description: See the undefined Permits & Regulations for undefined

faq.front-yard: 3 feet, 4 feet with approval by the city traffic engineer
faq.side-yard: 3 feet within street side setback, 6 feet beyond setback, 6 feet on interior side yard
faq.rear-max-height: 6 feet, as of 07/22/2021 a one-foot extension up to 7 feet with a decorative finish such as lattice is allowed.
faq.corner-lot-rules: 3 feet max height on 35 feet visibility triangle Area measured from property lines. https://library.municode.com/ca/vallejo/codes/code_of_ordinances?nodeId=TIT10STSI_CH10.14OBVIIN

articles.description: If you’re looking to get a new fence in California, it’s important to know about the laws surrounding fences and home improvement projects. Our post will go over some important things to keep in mind.

When it’s time to get a new fence it’s important to always use a reputable, licensed, and insured contractor. Some people try to cut costs by using unlicensed contractors, but this can end up being a major issue if any problems happen during the installation or down the line. In this post, we’ll go over the main reasons why you should always use a licensed and insured fence contractor.
